Refers to the Basel Risk Type Identifier.

attributes.logicalName: Basel Risk Type Level Zero Description
attributes.gcd: This column stores the risk type identifier's description at the most granular level. This risk type is as per the regulatory driven values of Equity Risk, Securitization Risk, Investment Fund Risk, Non Securitization Risk, Counterparty Credit Risk etc. All these risks at a broad level fall into Credit Risk, which is captured in the Basel Risk Type Identifier Description.

attributes.logicalName: Basel Risk Type Level Zero Identifier
attributes.gcd: Refers to the risk type identifier at the most granular level. This risk type is as per the regulatory driven values of Equity Risk, Securitization Risk, Investment Fund Risk, Non Securitization Risk, Counterparty Credit Risk etc. All these risks at a broad level fall into Credit Risk, which is captured in the Basel Risk Type Identifier.

Refers to the source system from where data is extracted. Data can be sourced from multiple sources, this column will Refers to the source code from where the data is extracted for this extraction date.

Flag indicates whether the given dimension value record has been disabled or expired. The list of values includes Y- Indicates that the dimension value has been disabled, N- Indicates that the dimension value is not disabled and is still active.
Refers to the record creation date. It has been added to all catalog entities to enable partitioning and archival.
It Indicates if dimension record is seeded by product or not. The SCD component would not overwrite the record if it is set to 'Y'.
